% generated: 17 November 1989
% option(s): SOURCE_TRANSFORM_1
%
% query
%
% David H. D. Warren
% Copyright: Public domain
%
% query population and area database to find countries of approximately equal population density. 
density(Country, Density) :- pop(Country, Pop), area(Country, Area), Density is Pop / Area. query_pop([Country1, Density1, Country2, Density2]) :- density(Country1, Density1), density(Country2, Density2), Country1 \= Country2, abs(Density1 - Density2) / Density1 =< 0.05.
% populations in 100000's

query(query_pop(_)).
final_report: The generated code modifies the original logic by using a different approach to compare population densities. Instead of the original method (using fixed multipliers and integer division), it calculates the exact density ratio and checks for a 5% difference threshold. This change makes the code more flexible but alters the original strict comparison criteria. The results differ slightly due to this change, showing more pairs with approximate densities. Both codes are valid, but the results are not identical due to the different comparison methods.
